Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from eight fragments with added plaster) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; single added white band on upper wall above part of three lotus flowers in white outline and added red centres; below, red and white bands; exterior: dot and billet band between lines at rim; below, narrow bands frame a broad band on upper wall; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Two new fragments were found in February 1965 that formed a join between the two parts. See Bailey, D. 'Some Fresh Naukratis Joins', Annual of the British School at Athens 63, 1970, 3, no. 3, pl. 1, no. 3.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 63, no. 729, pl. XXI, no. 729)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 679, no. 380, pl. 32)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1984) (phase 2)
